metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: HTML URL Encoding Reference
URL - Uniform Resource Locator
Web browsers request pages from web servers by using a URL.
content.html: Web browsers request pages from web servers by using a URL.

content.text: The URL is the address of a web page, like: https://www.w3schools.com.
content.html: The URL is the address of a web page, like: https://www.w3schools.com.

content.text: URL Encoding (Percent Encoding)
URL encoding converts characters into a format that can be transmitted over the Internet.
content.html: URL encoding converts characters into a format that can be transmitted over the Internet.

content.text: URLs can only be sent over the Internet using the ASCII character-set .
content.html: URLs can only be sent over the Internet using the ASCII character-set.

content.text: Since URLs often contain characters outside the ASCII set, the URL has to be converted into a valid ASCII format.
content.html: Since URLs often contain characters outside the ASCII set, the URL has to be converted into a valid ASCII format.

content.text: URL encoding replaces unsafe ASCII characters with a "%" followed by two hexadecimal digits.
content.html: URL encoding replaces unsafe ASCII characters with a "%" followed by two hexadecimal digits.

content.text: URLs cannot contain spaces. URL encoding normally replaces a space with a plus (+) sign or with %20.
content.html: URLs cannot contain spaces. URL encoding normally replaces a space with a plus (+) sign or with %20.

content.text: Try It Yourself
If you click the "Submit" button below, the browser will URL encode the input before it is sent to the server. A page at the server will display the received input.
content.html: If you click the "Submit" button below, the browser will URL encode the input before it is sent to the server. A page at the server will display the received input.

content.text: Try some other input and click Submit again.
content.html: Try some other input and click Submit again.

content.text: URL Encoding Functions
In JavaScript, PHP, and ASP there are functions that can be used to URL encode a string.
content.html: In JavaScript, PHP, and ASP there are functions that can be used to URL encode a string.

content.text: PHP has the rawurlencode() function, and ASP has the Server.URLEncode() function.
content.html: PHP has the rawurlencode() function, and ASP has the Server.URLEncode() function.

content.text: In JavaScript you can use the encodeURIComponent() function.
content.html: In JavaScript you can use the encodeURIComponent() function.

content.text: Click the "URL Encode" button to see how the JavaScript function encodes the text.
content.html: Click the "URL Encode" button to see how the JavaScript function encodes the text.

content.text: Note: The JavaScript function encodes space as %20.
ASCII Encoding Reference
Your browser will encode input, according to the character-set used in your page.
content.html: Your browser will encode input, according to the character-set used in your page.

content.text: The default character-set in HTML5 is UTF-8.
content.html: The default character-set in HTML5 is UTF-8.

content.text: URL Encoding Reference
The ASCII control characters %00-%1F were originally designed to control hardware devices.
content.html: The ASCII control characters %00-%1F were originally designed to control hardware devices.

content.text: Control characters have nothing to do inside a URL.
content.html: Control characters have nothing to do inside a URL.

content.code_html:
ASCII Character Description URL-encoding
NUL null character %00
SOH start of header %01
STX start of text %02
ETX end of text %03
EOT end of transmission %04
ENQ enquiry %05
ACK acknowledge %06
BEL bell (ring) %07
BS backspace %08
HT horizontal tab %09
LF line feed %0A
VT vertical tab %0B
FF form feed %0C
CR carriage return %0D
SO shift out %0E
SI shift in %0F
DLE data link escape %10
DC1 device control 1 %11
DC2 device control 2 %12
DC3 device control 3 %13
DC4 device control 4 %14
NAK negative acknowledge %15
SYN synchronize %16
ETB end transmission block %17
CAN cancel %18
EM end of medium %19
SUB substitute %1A
ESC escape %1B
FS file separator %1C
GS group separator %1D
RS record separator %1E
US unit separator %1F
